page.title: 13Tavistock Fire Station
page.content: Tavistock Fire Station is one of 58 stations in Devon, and has to cover an { area of 300 square miles.}It was built in 1979 at a cost of Â£96,000. There are 2 fire engines worth about Â£42,000 each.They are{well equipped}to put out fires and rescue people from crashes. 20 men are stationed in Tavistock, and all of them are{ part-time {retained firemen.}They have other full-time jobs. They always carry a radio bleeper and if there is a fire somewhere, it sounds. If they are on call, they rush to the Fire Station. Last year, they dealt with about 200 fires or crashes. In the summer the firemen are often called to put out{moorland fires.}
